articles.author: Laila Bassam, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: The mayor of a major town in south Lebanon was among 16 people killed when an Israeli airstrike destroyed its municipal headquarters in the biggest attack on an official Lebanese state building since the Israeli air campaign began.
articles.title: 16 dead in Israeli strike on Lebanese municipality building

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden takes off for Berlin on Thursday for a rapid visit to discuss Russia's invasion of Ukraine with the leaders of Germany, France and Britain as Kyiv urges its western allies to take urgent steps to end the fighting.
articles.title: Biden heads to Germany for talks on Ukraine, Middle East

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Landmines and unexploded bombs cover up to a quarter of the country - the most mined nation in the world.
articles.title: Ukraine seeks global help with massive task of landmine clearance at Swiss meeting

articles.author: Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: Migration will dominate the European Union summit on Thursday with Poland calling for an EU stance against Russia and Belarus using migrants as a weapon against the EU and others, urging sharper laws on sending back irregular arrivals, diplomats said.
articles.title: EU leaders to focus on migration, Poland to point to its 'weaponisation'

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes killed 11 Palestinians in Gaza City on Thursday, medics said, while Israeli forces sent tanks into Jabalia in the north, where Palestinians and United Nations officials expressed alarm over shortages of food and medicine.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 11 in Gaza City as its forces tighten siege in the north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Unemployment in Gaza has soared to nearly 80% since the Israel-Hamas war erupted, with the devastated enclave's economy in almost total collapse, the International Labour Organization said on Thursday.
articles.title: Gaza unemployment surges to 80% as economy collapses, UN agency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kenya's Senate opened a second day of hearings on Thursday ahead of a vote on whether to remove Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua from office over charges he embezzled public funds, stirred ethnic hatred and undermined the government, which he denies.
articles.title: Kenya's Senate to vote on removal of deputy president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has designated South Korea a "hostile state", its state media said on Thursday, confirming that its national assembly had amended the country's constitution in line with their leader's vow to drop unification as a national goal.
articles.title: North Korea calls South Korea 'hostile state' indicating constitution change

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: China is building its capacity to rapidly turn military drills into a full-out attack, a senior Taiwan security official said, providing the Taipei government's assessment of the strategic intent behind Beijing's war games around the island this week.
articles.title: China building capacity to rapidly strike Taiwan, senior Taiwanese official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's ruling party may lose its sole majority in the lower house for the first time in 15 years, the Nikkei newspaper said on Thursday, citing its poll ahead of the Oct. 27 election.
articles.title: Japan's ruling LDP at risk of losing majority in election, Nikkei poll shows
